content:
• Monday, January 30, 2012
  • RCII

    More on Rent-A-Center (NASDAQ:RCII): Q4 misses on revenue due to acquisition-related...

    More on Rent-A-Center (NASDAQ:RCII): Q4 misses on revenue due to acquisition-related restructuring charges. The company also forecasts low, single-digit growth in the U.S., and guides FY12 earnings lower. It now expects to earn in a range between $3.00 to $3.20 a share, below the Street forecast of $3.22. Going forward the company says it will no longer be providing quarterly EPS guidance. Shares -5.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM
  • RTEC

    More on Rudolph Technologies (NASDAQ:RTEC): Q4 easily beats expectations on solid customer order...

    More on Rudolph Technologies (NASDAQ:RTEC): Q4 easily beats expectations on solid customer order flow. Book-to-bill was over 50% higher than the industry average over the same period, as the company recorded its highest order total since the Q2 2010. Shares +3.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM
  • HOLX

    More on Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX): FQ1 beats expectations across the board as earnings rose 90% Y/Y...

    More on Hologic (NASDAQ:HOLX): FQ1 beats expectations across the board as earnings rose 90% Y/Y on broad revenue growth. The company also raises its FY12 EPS guidance, now expecting to earn between $1.36 - $1.38, and affirmed its revenue view. Shares +6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:23 PM
  • LEAF

    Demand Media (DMD) drops 1.9% AH after paidContent reports three senior execs who have been with...

    Demand Media (DMD) drops 1.9% AH after paidContent reports three senior execs who have been with the company for 7 years are leaving. A company spokesperson declares their simultaneous departure to be "just coincidence." Demand had a difficult 2011, in which it dealt with a loss of Google traffic following the search giant's Panda update, and discontent among its army of freelance writers.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:20 PM
  • GBDC

    Golub Capital (NASDAQ:GBDC) falls 2% AH after warning FQ1 EPS will be in a range of $0.28-$0.31,...

    Golub Capital (NASDAQ:GBDC) falls 2% AH after warning FQ1 EPS will be in a range of $0.28-$0.31, below a $0.33 consensus, and announcing a 3.5M share stock offering, worth $54.7M as of today's close. Golub intends to use the proceeds to invest in portfolio companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM
  • PRXL

    More on Parexel's FQ2: Though results were only in-line, the company is guiding for FQ3 revenue...

    More on Parexel's FQ2: Though results were only in-line, the company is guiding for FQ3 revenue of $350M-$358M ($334.2M consensus) and EPS of $0.30-$0.32 ($0.23 consensus). In addition, it's guiding for FY12 (ends in June) revenue of $1.36B-$1.375B ($1.36B consensus) and EPS of $1.09-$1.17 ($1.11 consensus). PRXL now +10% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • NOVUF

    Keep an eye on Canadian light oil producer Novus Energy (OTC:NOVUF) before the open tomorrow...

    Keep an eye on Canadian light oil producer Novus Energy (OTC:NOVUF) before the open tomorrow after shares jumped into the close on no published news. Novus is a rapidly growing producer focused on the Viking light oil resource play, and would make a natural acquisition target for larger players such as Penn West (PWE). (submitted by Devon Shire)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • DISH

    Dish Network (DISH +2.8%) closed higher after Credit Suisse noted AT&T (NYSE:T) has dropped...

    Dish Network (DISH +2.8%) closed higher after Credit Suisse noted AT&T (NYSE:T) has dropped its call for an extensive FCC review of Dish's request for a waiver that would allow it to use its spectrum to provide 4G mobile services. Credit Suisse sees the move as evidence AT&T, which is facing a spectrum shortage following the collapse of the T-Mobile deal, is hungry to buy Dish's airwaves. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • ALGN

    More on Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Beats Q4 on as per share basis but comes up just shy on...

    More on Align Technology (NASDAQ:ALGN): Beats Q4 on as per share basis but comes up just shy on revenues, as profit more than doubled Y/Y on strong shipments of its trademark Invisalign teeth aligners. Shares are lower in the post-session however, as the company guides the current quarter below estimates, now expecting Q1 EPS to come in between $0.19 - $0.21. The Street is at $0.22. Shares -5.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • MCK

    More on McKesson's FQ3: The company expects FY12 EPS of $6.19-$6.39, compared with a $6.33...

    More on McKesson's FQ3: The company expects FY12 EPS of $6.19-$6.39, compared with a $6.33 consensus. It's also acquiring Drug Trading Company Ltd., the "marketing and purchasing arm" for a network of over 850 Canadian pharmacies, and Medicine Shoppe, a provider of services to over 160 Canadian pharmacies, from Katz Group. The deal will cost ~$918M in cash. MCK +3.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • RSH

    RadioShack (NYSE:RSH) -18.7% AH on weak Q4 guidance, seeing EPS of $0.11-$0.13 vs. $0.36...

    RadioShack (NYSE:RSH) -18.7% AH on weak Q4 guidance, seeing EPS of $0.11-$0.13 vs. $0.36 consensus, blaming underperformance of the Sprint (NYSE:S) postpaid wireless business and a highly promotional holiday season. Q4 revenues are projected slightly above consensus, $1.39B vs. $1.35B. S -1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • REXX

    Rex Energy (NASDAQ:REXX) drops 5.8% AH after announcing a 7M share stock offering, good for...

    Rex Energy (NASDAQ:REXX) drops 5.8% AH after announcing a 7M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $74.3M as of today's close. The oil & gas producer plans to use the proceeds to repay borrowing made through its credit facility. Rex is also releasing its February 2012 corporate presentation.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • HIBB

    Sporting goods retailer Hibbett Sports (HIBB -2.4%) says its CFO Gary Smith will be retiring...

    Sporting goods retailer Hibbett Sports (HIBB -2.4%) says its CFO Gary Smith will be retiring effective in June. The company has begun an immediate search for his replacement.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • GDP

    Oil and Gas producer Goodrich Petroleum (GDP -2.4%) finishes the day lower after Tudor Pickering...

    Oil and Gas producer Goodrich Petroleum (GDP -2.4%) finishes the day lower after Tudor Pickering cut the shares to Accumulate on valuation, saying the stock need to "cool off some" after this month's surge.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -3.7%) shares tumble after 2012 sales estimates are slashed for the...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -3.7%) shares tumble after 2012 sales estimates are slashed for the company's new Incivek hepatitis C pill to $1.5B from $2.3B by Leerink Swann, which notes the drug could be eclipsed by new pill-only treatments with fewer side effects and shorter courses of treatment. The firm lowers its stock price target to $48 from $66.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • DHI

    D.R. Horton (DHI -2.3%) dips after Keefe, Bruyette & Woods cut the home-building company to...

    D.R. Horton (DHI -2.3%) dips after Keefe, Bruyette & Woods cut the home-building company to Market Perform on valuation. The firm notes that despite its strong operating leverage relative to peers, the stock hit a nearly two-year high last week and already incorporates expectations for strong operating performance.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • PFE

    Pfizer (PFE +0.1%) says it's preparing to seek U.S. regulatory approval to sell a new menopause...

    Pfizer (PFE +0.1%) says it's preparing to seek U.S. regulatory approval to sell a new menopause drug, Aprela, as a potential alternative to the company's older hormone-replacement therapies, which have been tied in the past to safety risks.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +2.1%) had good news for investors today as it increased its estimated 2012...

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +2.1%) had good news for investors today as it increased its estimated 2012 exit rate to 15,000 Boe/d. In December, Magnum had increased this to 14,500 Boe/d from its original 13,000 Boe/d. Production increases were noted in the Bakken, Eagle Ford and Marcellus/Utica shales. (submitted by Michael Filloon)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR +4.4%) tops the S&P 500 on speculation that it could be a takeover...

    Nabors Industries (NBR +4.4%) tops the S&P 500 on speculation that it could be a takeover candidate after the departure of its 81-year-old CEO. In the past two weeks, option calls priced 10% above NBR stock rose the most in 18 months vs. puts on one-month contracts, signaling traders are anticipating an acquisition, Jones Trading says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    Investors may be a bit too bullish on the Nasdaq 100 (QQQ +0.2%) following the index’s...

    Investors may be a bit too bullish on the Nasdaq 100 (QQQ +0.2%) following the index’s recent rally to decade highs, as Tom McClellan suspects sentiment readings and a classic reversal signal suggest a significant pullback at hand. But sure enough, techs are leading an intraday rally that's trimming losses on the major indexes. AAPL +1.3%, DELL-OLD +1.8% and MSFT +1.1% lead the way.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • HDY

    Shares of Hyperdynamics (HDY -19.6%) resumes trading, down sharply, after the firm floats a $30M...

    Shares of Hyperdynamics (HDY -19.6%) resumes trading, down sharply, after the firm floats a $30M issuance of stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • SIEGY

    Siemens (SI -1.4%) agrees to acquire Canada's RuggedCom, a maker of industrial-grade networking...

    Siemens (SI -1.4%) agrees to acquire Canada's RuggedCom, a maker of industrial-grade networking gear, for C$33/share in cash, or $381M. The offer represents more than a 25% premium to RuggedCom's Friday's close on the Toronto exchange, and easily trumps a C$22/share offer from Belden (BDC -1.9%). Belden has responded to the news by officially ending its bid.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • ETFC

    Shares of E-Trade Financial (ETFC +1.2%) trade higher after it names Frank Petrilli as its new...

    Shares of E-Trade Financial (ETFC +1.2%) trade higher after it names Frank Petrilli as its new chairman, replacing Chief Executive Steven Freiberg.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • MS

    Another piece of upbeat news for Morgan Stanley (MS -1%) as it moves toward sealing the deal to...

    Another piece of upbeat news for Morgan Stanley (MS -1%) as it moves toward sealing the deal to lead Facebook's IPO: Zynga (ZNGA +3.5%), last year's top internet IPO, has climbed back above its IPO price of $10. Getting ZNGA back above the IPO price might help the MS sales pitch if it needs to do any more work to finalize the Facebook deal. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • RJETQ

    Republic Airways (RJET +3.2%) moves up again today as speculation continues to swirl around a...

    Republic Airways (RJET +3.2%) moves up again today as speculation continues to swirl around a potential sale of its Frontier Airlines unit. The stock has soared more than 23% over the past few trading sessions, after the company appointed a new chief executive to the airline, in what many believe is a necessary step towards putting it up for sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power Systems (BLDP +3.1%) trades up after the company signs a deal with Tata Motors...

    Ballard Power Systems (BLDP +3.1%) trades up after the company signs a deal with Tata Motors (TTM -1.5%) to provide 12 FCvelocity-1100 fuel cell stacks that will power zero-emission buses for use in India urban areas. Delivery is planned for 2012 and 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • CMLP

    Inergy (NRGY +3.7%) gets a boost from a BofA upgrade to Buy on valuation, following the heavy...

    Inergy (NRGY +3.7%) gets a boost from a BofA upgrade to Buy on valuation, following the heavy -23% drubbing the stock took on Friday. The sell-off was due to the company considering a cash distribution cut, a move in which the bank notes wasn't totally unexpected.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • UBS

    Euro bank stocks were hit hard once again, as a new round of Greek bailout fears triggered a...

    Euro bank stocks were hit hard once again, as a new round of Greek bailout fears triggered a strong selloff. UBS -3.4%. BCS -4.8%. CS -3.5%. STD -3.7%. OTCPK:CRARY -7.4%. OTCQX:BNPQY -7.1%. OTCPK:SCGLY -7.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • VRZPF

    Peru oil explorer Veraz Petroleum (OTC:VRZPF) up over 30% on four-times normal volume with no...

    Peru oil explorer Veraz Petroleum (OTC:VRZPF) up over 30% on four-times normal volume with no published news. Veraz and 80% partner Petrominerales (OTCPK:PMGLF) are drilling a high-impact well in Peru named La Colpa2X, which, if successful, would be a company maker for Veraz and very material for Petrominerales as well. (submitted by Devon Shire)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • PHG

    Philips' (PHG -2%) soft Q4 report (I, II), which was followed by earnings call remarks...

    Philips' (PHG -2%) soft Q4 report (I, II), which was followed by earnings call remarks forecasting the recent weakness seen in Philips' Lumileds LED product line will continue in 1H12, appears to be pressuring the shares of other LED industry players. CREE -3.6%. LEDS -4.7%. AIXG -3.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • BMY

    Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN +18.7%) jumps after the FDA approved Bydureon, its weekly treatment...

    Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN +18.7%) jumps after the FDA approved Bydureon, its weekly treatment for diabetes, on Friday. Alkermes (ALKS +0.8%), its partner on the drug, is also up on heavy volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • SBSAA

    Shares of Spanish Broadcasting System (SBSA +14.1%) move higher after the media company...

    Shares of Spanish Broadcasting System (SBSA +14.1%) move higher after the media company announces that it will float an offering of $275M in senior notes in order to pay off an outstanding first lien credit line.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • CYNO

    Cynosure (CYNO +6.7%) jumps after saying its Cellulaze Workstation, a minimally invasive...

    Cynosure (CYNO +6.7%) jumps after saying its Cellulaze Workstation, a minimally invasive aesthetic device for the treatment of cellulite, has been cleared by the FDA for commercial distribution in U.S. markets. The company is also currently pursing regulatory approval in Canada, the EU, Australia and South Korea.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • ENMD

    Shares of EntreMed (ENMD -13.5%) give back a hefty portion of last week's gains tied to partner...

    Shares of EntreMed (ENMD -13.5%) give back a hefty portion of last week's gains tied to partner Celgene's acquisition of Avila Technologies, but are still sporting a 137% YTD return on the promise of a banner year for royalty payments on Thalomid.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • ONCY

    Shares of Oncolytics Biotech (ONCY +31.1%) skyrocket after chatter picks up that the...

    Shares of Oncolytics Biotech (ONCY +31.1%) skyrocket after chatter picks up that the development-stage biopharmaceutical firm has caught the eye of bigger rivals in the space.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • RENN

    Renren (RENN +10.1%), nicknamed "the Facebook of China," continues to soar (previously)...

    Renren (RENN +10.1%), nicknamed "the Facebook of China," continues to soar (previously) following reports the actual Facebook will soon be filing an S-1. However, some of the other names that rallied on the news are selling off: QPSA -2.5%. LNKD -1.9%. GSVC -3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • NS

    NuStar Energy (NS -2.2%) dips on a downgrade to Market Perform from Outperform at Raymond James....

    NuStar Energy (NS -2.2%) dips on a downgrade to Market Perform from Outperform at Raymond James. Separately, the company is planning to issue $250M in 10-year notes to the U.S. credit markets today.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • CF

    CF Industries (CF -1.7%) is lowered to Hold from Buy at Dahlman Rose, not just because the...

    CF Industries (CF -1.7%) is lowered to Hold from Buy at Dahlman Rose, not just because the fertilizer company's shares have hit the firm's target price after surging nearly 40% in recent weeks, but on worries about underlying ag fundamentals. Record corn planting and a strong harvest will pressure corn pricing and ultimately nitrogen margins, the firm believes.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +1.6%) moves up on a down day for stocks, showing continued momentum after surging...

    Netflix (NFLX +1.6%) moves up on a down day for stocks, showing continued momentum after surging last week on upbeat news on Q4 earnings. But B. Riley thinks the rally has run its course, cutting its rating to Neutral from Buy; while it's overall view of NFLX remains positive, it suggests investors wait for "a more attractive entry point."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 3 Comments
  • CRIS

    Curis (CRIS -4.5%) trades rather violently after the FDA approves Erivedge for use to treat...

    Curis (CRIS -4.5%) trades rather violently after the FDA approves Erivedge for use to treat adult patients with skin cancer. Shares spiked up 7%, then sank 14% before quickly heading back north.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • ACH

    Aluminum Corp. of China (ACH -9.3%) plunges after warning it expects to post a Q4 operating...

    Aluminum Corp. of China (ACH -9.3%) plunges after warning it expects to post a Q4 operating loss, and sees its 2011 net profit falling 50% Y/Y. The company blames a combo of falling aluminum prices and rising electricity prices (increases production costs).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • MRVL

    Nomura (Neutral) responds to Marvell's (MRVL -1.8%) FQ4 warning by issuing a downbeat note....

    Nomura (Neutral) responds to Marvell's (MRVL -1.8%) FQ4 warning by issuing a downbeat note. Though believing FQ4 (ends this month) will represent a sales bottom, Nomura expects a slow recovery on account of weak PC demand, and share losses to Spreadtrum (NASDAQ:SPRD) in the market for TD-SCDMA baseband chips (used in phones on China Mobile's 3G network). Others are more bullish.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • OAS

    More bad production news from the Bakken today as Oasis (OAS -2.3%) missed its full-year 2011...

    More bad production news from the Bakken today as Oasis (OAS -2.3%) missed its full-year 2011 guidance. Not a big surprise, since Oasis warned it would come in at the low-end of guidance back in October. Still, full-year daily production of 10,724 Boe/d fell well short of previous guidance of 11,000-12,500 Boe/d. (submitted by Michael Filloon)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • OMC

    Omnicom (OMC -1.5%) dips on a BMO downgrade to Market Perform on valuation. The stock has been a...

    Omnicom (OMC -1.5%) dips on a BMO downgrade to Market Perform on valuation. The stock has been a solid performer over the last quarter, gaining nearly 30% since early October.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • KOG

    Shares of Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG) are -2.5% after quarterly sales fall short. KOG's...

    Shares of Kodiak Oil & Gas (NYSE:KOG) are -2.5% after quarterly sales fall short. KOG's 7,195 of Boe/d missed its own guidance of 7500-8000 Boe/d. For the full-year, Kodiak also came up short, selling 3,922 Boe/d vs. guidance of 4500-5000 Boe/d, though quarterly sales were +422% Y/Y and +82% Q/Q. (submitted by Michael Filloon)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 2 Comments
  • GCI

    In what could be a troubling datapoint for the media industry, Gannett (GCI -7.1%) claims ad...

    In what could be a troubling datapoint for the media industry, Gannett (GCI -7.1%) claims ad spending softened in December, with some retailers showing "apprehension." Slowing ad spending played a role in Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) Q4 miss, though the weakness was centered more around Europe than the U.S. (Gannett Q4)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • C

    While Goldman Sachs was raising Citigroup (C -1.7%) to Buy from Neutral, the firm also...

    While Goldman Sachs was raising Citigroup (C -1.7%) to Buy from Neutral, the firm also downgraded Bank of America (BAC -2.9%) to Neutral from Buy, believing it will be difficult for BofA to boost earnings power over the next 12-18 months as it also cuts costs. Goldman also hiked Morgan Stanley (MS -0.9%) to its Conviction Buy list while removing JPMorgan Chase (JPM -1.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • EMKR

    Well, that didn't go as planned: Emcore (EMKR -15.1%) tumbles after announcing a 1-for-4 reverse...

    Well, that didn't go as planned: Emcore (EMKR -15.1%) tumbles after announcing a 1-for-4 reverse stock split. Perhaps investors fear the move is an attempt to draw attention away from Emcore's bleak near-term fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • GCI

    Shares of Gannett (GCI -7.3%) lead the decline in the S&P 500 this morning, despite beating...

    Shares of Gannett (GCI -7.3%) lead the decline in the S&P 500 this morning, despite beating Q4 EPS estimates. Profit dipped 5% Y/Y as a decline in advertising at its newspapers and lower television revenue swamped modest growth in the publisher's digital businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • SPLS

    Staples (SPLS -3.9%) shares are cut to Sell from Neutral by Goldman Sachs, citing a...

    Staples (SPLS -3.9%) shares are cut to Sell from Neutral by Goldman Sachs, citing a “tough” outlook for the global printing segment. The firm expects the world's largest office products company to face sluggish demand as core supplies categories remain in a period of secular stagnation. Goldman lowers its price target to $15.75 from $17.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • DAL

    Buyer or seller? Talk of Delta Air Lines (DAL +0.1%) making a run to buy US Airways (LCC +2.7%)...

    Buyer or seller? Talk of Delta Air Lines (DAL +0.1%) making a run to buy US Airways (LCC +2.7%) continues, even as LCC prepares to submit a merger plan with AMR (AAMRQ.PK) that would help the carrier boost revenue and profits.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • PMC

    Though PharMerica (PMC -12.6%) remains off sharply following the FTC's decision to block...

    Though PharMerica (PMC -12.6%) remains off sharply following the FTC's decision to block Omnicare's (OCR -1.4%) hostile bid, the company says it's pleased with the move. Meanwhile, Barclays and Cowen recommend buying Omnicare on any post-FTC weakness, arguing its fundamentals are sound regardless of whether a merger occurs.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • CCL

    Carnival (CCL -2.4%) warns that a combination of the Costa Concordia shipwreck along with fuel...

    Carnival (CCL -2.4%) warns that a combination of the Costa Concordia shipwreck along with fuel and currency cost will cut into 2012 EPS by $0.48-$0.51.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 2 Comments
  • TLB

    Shares of Talbots (NYSE:TLB) push up 4.4% premarket after Sycamore Partners enters a...

    Shares of Talbots (NYSE:TLB) push up 4.4% premarket after Sycamore Partners enters a confidentiality pact with the firm. (SEC filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) moves up 6.5% premarket after traders line up the...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) moves up 6.5% premarket after traders line up the biopharmaceutical company as a juicy candidate for a takeover bid.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • PBY-OLD

    Premarket gainers: PBY-OLD +25%. GTXI +24%. TNB +23%. AMLN +14%. LCC +7%. ARNA +7%. PTNR...

    Premarket gainers: PBY-OLD +25%. GTXI +24%. TNB +23%. AMLN +14%. LCC +7%. ARNA +7%. PTNR +4%.
    Losers: CTIC -18%. PMC -14%. DB -6%. ING -5%. BCS -5%. MT -5%. CHU -4%. STD -4%. AKS -3%. DANG -3%. PLX -3%. PT-OLD -3%. JASO -3%. KOG -3%. X -3%. ANR -3%. RIG -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • GTXI

    Shares of GTx (NASDAQ:GTXI) hit warp speed, up 23.2%, after Citigroup raises its price target on...

    Shares of GTx (NASDAQ:GTXI) hit warp speed, up 23.2%, after Citigroup raises its price target on shares to $19 from $8 on takeover potential. Analysts predict that a successful trial of the firm's ostarine drug will help it to attract suitors.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • SINA

    Shares of Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) trail off 1.5% premarket after ripping a 12.1% gain Friday on a...

    Shares of Sina (NASDAQ:SINA) trail off 1.5% premarket after ripping a 12.1% gain Friday on a trading frenzy tied to news about Facebook's IPO. Analyst see even more upside with Maxim increasing its price target and Stifel Nicolaus saying the Facebook effect will be an ongoing positive driver.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • LCI

    Shares of Lannett Company (NYSEMKT:LCI) gain 3.6% premarket after the company lands FDA approval...

    Shares of Lannett Company (NYSEMKT:LCI) gain 3.6% premarket after the company lands FDA approval for its Hydrochlorothiazide capsules used to treat high blood pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • MSTR

    MicroStrategy (NASDAQ:MSTR): Q4 EPS of $0.81 misses by $0.13. Revenue of $160.3M (+15.2% Y/Y)...

    MicroStrategy (NASDAQ:MSTR): Q4 EPS of $0.81 misses by $0.13. Revenue of $160.3M (+15.2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM
  • BHC

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) withdraws its buyout offer of $7.50 per share for ITSA...

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) withdraws its buyout offer of $7.50 per share for ITSA Pharmaceuticals (ISTA) due to what it calls a "lack of progress" with ISTA's management team. Shares of ISTA -8.4% premarket.
